007package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
008
009import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
010import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
011import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
012
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014import java.util.List;
015
016/**
017 * The core class.
018 * 
019 * @author WB
020 * @version 2022/04/15
021 */
022public class FaceDetector {
023        // TODO: change constructors to use the source image, pre-calculate everything.
024        // TODO: use annotations on Parameters fields
025        /**
026         * Nested class representing parameters and their default values.
027         */
028        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle<FaceDetector> {
029                /** The initial ratio between the window size and the Haar classifier size (default 2). */
030                public double baseScale = 2.00;
031                
032                /** The scale increment of the window size, at each step (default 1.25). */
033                public double scaleStep = 1.25;
034                
035                /** The shift of the window at each sub-step, in terms of percentage of the window size. */
036                public double winShiftFraction = 0.1;
037                
038                /** The minimum number of rectangles needed for the corresponding detection to be kept */
039                public int minNeighbors = 1;
040                
041                /** Flag indicating if Canny pruning should be applied. */
042                public boolean doGradientPruning = false;
043                
044                /** The minimum percentage of overlap for merging two regions. */
045                public double minMergeRegionOverlap = 0.2;
046                
047                /** The width of the Gaussian blur applied before gradient calculation. */
048                public double gradientSigma = 2.0;
049                
050                /** The minimum (normalized) gradient magnitude if pruning is on. */
051                public double minGradientMagnitude = 20;
052                
053                /** The maximum (normalized) gradient magnitude if pruning is on. */
054                public double maxGradientMagnitude = 100;
055        }
056        
057        private final Parameters params;
058        private final HaarCascadeDescriptor cascade;
059        
060        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
061        
062        /**
063         *  The only constructor.
064         * @param cascade a Haar cascade descriptor
065         * @param params a parameter object (default settings are used if {@code null} is passed)
066         */
067        public FaceDetector(HaarCascadeDescriptor cascade, Parameters params) {
068                this.cascade = cascade;
069                this.params = (params != null) ? params : new Parameters();
070        }
071        
072        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
073
074        /**
075         * Detects faces in the supplied image.
076         * @param ip the input image
077         * @return the list of rectangles containing searched objects
078         */
079        public List<FaceRegion> findFaces(ByteProcessor ip) {
080                return findFaces(ip.getIntArray());
081        }
082        
083        public List<FaceRegion> findFaces(int[][] I) {
084                List<FaceRegion> facelist = new LinkedList<FaceRegion>();
085                final int imgW = I.length;
086                final int imgH = I[0].length;
087        
088                // maximum size of detector is the whole image 
089                double maxScale = Math.min(
090                                (double) imgW / cascade.getWidth(),
091                                (double) imgH / cascade.getHeight());
092                
093                //IJ.log("maxScale = " + maxScale);
094
095                IntegralImage II = new IntegralImage(I);
096
097                // precalculate Canny edges if option is on
098                //int[][] canny = null;
099                IntegralImage canny = null;
100                if (params.doGradientPruning) {
101                        //canny = CannyPruner.getIntegralCanny(I);
102                        canny = Gradient.makeGradientIntegral(I, params.gradientSigma);
103                }
104
105                // apply the detector at each scale:
106                double scale = params.baseScale;
107                while (scale < maxScale) {
108                        //IJ.log("scale = " + scale);
109                        // calculate the sliding step of the window in each direction:
110                        final int uStep = (int) Math.round(scale * cascade.getWidth() * params.winShiftFraction);
111                        final int vStep = (int) Math.round(scale * cascade.getHeight() * params.winShiftFraction);
112                        final int curW =  (int) Math.round(scale * cascade.getWidth());
113                        final int curH =  (int) Math.round(scale * cascade.getHeight());
114        
115                        // check each position of the window on the image:
116                        for (int v = 0; v < imgH - curH; v += vStep) {
117                                for (int u = 0; u < imgW - curW; u += uStep) {
118                                        /*
119                                         * If Canny pruning is on, compute the edge density of the
120                                         * zone. If it is too low, the object should not be there so
121                                         * skip the region.
122                                         */
123                                        if (params.doGradientPruning) {
124                                                //int edges_density = canny[u + curW][v + curH] + canny[u][v] - canny[u][v + curH] - canny[u + curW][v];
125                                                double gradientMag = canny.getBlockSum1(u, v, u + curW - 1, v + curH - 1);
126                                                double d = gradientMag / (curW * curH);
127                                                if (d < params.minGradientMagnitude || d > params.maxGradientMagnitude)
128                                                        continue;       // skip this region
129                                        }
130                                        
131                                        // apply each detector stage to the current window, reject if one stage fails
132                                        boolean pass = true;
133                                        for (Stage stage : cascade.getStages()) {
134                                                if (!stage.pass(II, u, v, scale)) {
135                                                        pass = false;
136                                                        break;
137                                                }
138                                        }
139                                        // if current window passed all stages, add to the results
140                                        if (pass) {
141                                                facelist.add(new FaceRegion(u, v, curW, curH));
142                                        }
143                                }
144                        }
145                        scale = scale * params.scaleStep;
146                }
147
148                return merge(facelist.toArray(new FaceRegion[0]),
149                                params.minNeighbors, params.minMergeRegionOverlap);
150        }
151
152        /**
153         * Merge the raw detections resulting from the detection step to avoid multiple detections of the same object. A
154         * threshold on the minimum numbers of rectangles that need to be merged for the resulting detection to be kept can
155         * be given, to lower the rate of false detections. Two rectangles need to be merged if they overlap enough.
156         *
157         * @param facesInit the raw detections returned by the detection algorithm
158         * @param min_neighbors the minimum number of rectangles needed for the corresponding detection to be kept
159         * @param minOverlap the minimum overlap required for merging two faces
160         * @return The merged rectangular detections.
161         */
162        List<FaceRegion> merge(FaceRegion[] facesInit, int min_neighbors, double minOverlap) {
163                // TODO: CHECK!! Make rectangles immutable!
164                List<FaceRegion> facesMerged = new LinkedList<FaceRegion>();
165                int[] result = new int[facesInit.length];
166                int nb_classes = 0;
167                for (int i = 0; i < facesInit.length; i++) {
168                        boolean found = false;
169                        for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
170                                if (facesInit[j].overlaps(facesInit[i], minOverlap)) {
171                                        found = true;
172                                        result[i] = result[j];
173                                }
174                        }
175                        if (!found) {
176                                result[i] = nb_classes;
177                                nb_classes++;
178                        }
179                }
180                int[] neighbors = new int[nb_classes];
181                FaceRegion[] facesTmp = new FaceRegion[nb_classes];
182                
183                for (int i = 0; i < nb_classes; i++) {
184                        neighbors[i] = 0;
185                        facesTmp[i] = new FaceRegion(0, 0, 0, 0);       // TODO: make more efficient/polish!
186                }
187                
188                for (int i = 0; i < facesInit.length; i++) {
189                        neighbors[result[i]]++;
190                        int x = facesTmp[result[i]].x + facesInit[i].x;
191                        int y = facesTmp[result[i]].y + facesInit[i].y;
192                        int w = facesTmp[result[i]].height + facesInit[i].height;
193                        int h = facesTmp[result[i]].width + facesInit[i].width;
194                        facesTmp[result[i]] = new FaceRegion(x, y, w, h);
195                }
196                
197                for (int i = 0; i < nb_classes; i++) {
198                        int n = neighbors[i];
199                        if (n >= min_neighbors) {
200                                int x = (facesTmp[i].x * 2 + n) / (2 * n);
201                                int y = (facesTmp[i].y * 2 + n) / (2 * n);
202                                int w = (facesTmp[i].width * 2 + n) / (2 * n);
203                                int h = (facesTmp[i].height * 2 + n) / (2 * n);
204                                facesMerged.add(new FaceRegion(x, y, w, h));
205                        }
206                }
207                
208                return facesMerged;
209        }
210
211}
